channel.title: Getting rid of 'Unregistered Version'. [1.7.3]
channel.description:
Since I have a paid version, and Notch is too much of an idiot to just re-filter logins via the game's .jar, rather than checking your IP when buying the game, with your newer IP (or IP's within all users? idk).
Anyways, since I have a paid version, and still get this showing up. I was very obligated to find where the class was (credits to z-file searcher lmfao, made it fairly fast), and got it decompiled (no repair needed) etc. This just just removes/trims the 3 strings use in there. If anybody has problems, please feel free to post. I will try to keep updating this for as long as I can (keeping previous download links).
How to install: [ul][li]Open up the minecraft.jar via winrar(game, not launcher)[/li] [li]Delete the META-INF folder (needed, as this holds the MD5 checksum and such)[/li] [li]Replace the vm.class inside of the jar with the one provided (drag and drop onto winrar, it should auto-replace)[/li] [li]Close winrar, and re-try logging in.[/li][/ul]
Download: (Minecraft versions) [b]Version 1.7.3[/b] (credits to vuclass) http://uppit.com/y7jnncfuzcks/vu.class
[b]Version 1.7.2[/b] (credits to vuclass for finding) http://www.speedyshare.com/files/29240956/vu.class
[b]Version 1.6.6[/b] http://uppit.com/2tel5l2bbxta/vm.class
[b]Version 1.6.5[/b] http://uppit.com/8ml6cy6gyswn/vm.class
[b]Version 1.6.4:[/b] http://uppit.com/f2ok4otwbtpg/vm.class

[quote=“Acorn_, post:39, topic:396720”]For 1.7.3 it’d be, vu.class.
Although now that 1.8 has been released I don’t think it checks to see anymore whether or not you’ve purchased it.[/quote]
As of pre-release for 1.8 there was no checking, or at least not strings to be painted. I will be checking if official 1.8 does when I get home from work and update the title with (obsolete) if Notch removed this.

hope you know, none of you need to wait for him to update O-o you can find it yourself if you go through the java coding and look for "Unregistered version "

no they can buy it lol

You also get the ‘unregistered version’ thing from signing in from a different location, if you bought the game, of course.
[/quote]

i changed my isp recently i still dont get it and i think they judge by ip…[/quote]
they dont judge by ip, it takes 24 hours for your account to transfer to the register’d version, even if you successfully login, that part is apart of the website but the “unregistered version :(” is in a java file just remove that and its no longer there

item.title: Getting rid of 'Unregistered Version'. [1.7.3]
item.dc:creator: @vuclass vuclass
item.description:
@vuclass wrote:

hey, I’m sorry. This time I answer in English^^.
The two files I already posted are working for me (using Minecraft 1.7.2). If you are not trusting me you can decompile the two files and look at the sourcecode and compare it with the original (only three strings are changed). You can use this program (http://java.decompiler.free.fr/?q=jdgui) to decompile the class file or ask google for an other program…

Now I will explane what the two files do (that you just have to replace in your minecraft.jar):

[quote=“vuclass, post:28, topic:396720”]1.7.2
vu.class with “Minecraft Beta 1.7.2”:
http://www.speedyshare.com/files/29240921/vu.class[/quote]

this one will show “Minecraft Beta 1.7.2” in the upper left corner in the game.
and

[quote=“vuclass, post:28, topic:396720”]vu.class without “Minecraft Beta 1.7.2”:
http://www.speedyshare.com/files/29240956/vu.class[/quote]

this one will show nothing in the upper left corner in the game.

Have fun!

Read full topic

I am going to need to do more work than normal (or should be needed) to be able to successfully re-compile a new class file. Or in this case, a new several class files. Although I may be able to get away with doing some research and adding to he vu class an take out the need to rename the do class.
